{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3273243,"name":"","username":"Jacuzzi","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/cab0a1/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-05T18:15:57.456Z","cooked":"

Hi! For the first time, team 1939 will be releasing our off-season CAD.

There are 2 main projects we did in CAD this fall

  1. Swerve- We finally have a swerve drive up an running, and this is our second iteration of the base, and what we hope to use for the season, size-permitting. We did a lot of work to get the wiring harnesses done in Inventor and kicked out to a nailboard so that wiring our base can be a 30 minute task rather than a 3 day task.

  2. Parameterized Shooter- This is a project we weren’t able to fully flesh out, but it should be a good start if there’s a ball game. It relies on the new Vortex motors to be extra compact. (Note that it is called a turret. That was from our initial brainstorming, but we decided against a turret most likely, with the advent of swerve)

Here’s a link to the Inventor files.
